intro: Cupania liberiana, commonly known as the Liberian cupania, is a flowering plant native to West Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare species with potential ecological significance.
